title.label: You want to play this game? Emulate the original SNES game.

content.label: No port made has come close to the quality of the original game. Whether it’s inferior sound, graphics, or stability, Squareenix has failed every port of this amazing game. This one is no different. The art style completely clashes both on a visual coherency level and a tonal level. You know what doesn’t fit with a game that starts with dark storm clouds, an invading, murdering empire, and a young woman forced to burn dozens of soldiers alive while her mind was subjugated? Bright, brazen colors and character models that look pompous and inflated. Add in every battle screen having 4 separate, disjointed art styles between the characters, enemies, background, and menu... why is it so hard to make this game with current technology!? Hell. Get some tech savvy fans to do it Squareenix! They’ll do it faster, better, and with more passion than you can muster you pathetic, lifeless, greedy, lazy husks.
Crashes 1-2 times an hour.

I love this game, but the controls are absolute garbage compared to other FF game apps. This needs to be fixed. It makes a great game nearly unplayable. I’m so disappointed. I just played Dimensions and FF5. They both feel like driving a sports car compared to this app that handles like a lame donkey. Please fix this issue.
The game plays fine but there no sound

This is not a perfect port of the game (character sprite resolution conflicts with tile resolution among other things) but still, along with the PC release, the best version of this game. Some major glitches were fixed from the GBA version and, with that going for very high prices, this is great value! Would definitely recommend buying if you like Final Fantasy.

Let me start out by saying that I really like FF6, and am running this Mobile port on a brand new 1 week old, iPhone 11 Pro Max. First, even after reinstalling the app, the game crashes allot randomly. Second, for being a full priced game they didn’t do that great of a job with this port. Literally NO bug fixes (blood sword with Genji glove still drains your own chars health) and so on, and allot of the mini games( opera took me 30 tries) just simply are NOT made for a touch screen device, if I could request a refund I would. PS: to the people reviewing this saying “what a great port!” Please stop flat out lying to people, you either wouldn’t know a good port if it smacked you in the face or your intentionally misleading people.
I play the game and it doens’t crash but if I upload my date to the iCloud it crashes. It’s just small bug if you could please patch it that would be good.
This game on apple tv would be even better!

title.label: Excellent game but very poorly optimized for 2020

content.label: As of this review, I unfortunately report that the game has issues on iOS 13. I beg Square to optimize this game for iOS 13 and onwards. The game runs well enough, but it has completely random shutdowns and crashes every 15-30 minutes and the causes/timing are too random. They usually occur during battles- thank goodness for a robust autosave feature. Please optimize this game.

I love the game but would seriously warn anybody who wants to buy this that it crashes constantly!! There are not a lot of saves so there have been multiple times I have made a ton of progress, it crashes, and progress is completely lost... This is really unacceptable for $15 price tag. I wish I could get my money back since it is unplayable. Don’t buy this..

This is a game I love and have loved since it first came out for the SNES. However, the controls for the phones is absolutely, absolutely, absolutely terrible! Normally the directional control in the bottom left would be perfect, unfortunately wherever you put your finger the control pops up. So as your moving your finger across the “pad” its terribly inaccurate causing you to often go in directions you don’t want to or not being able to go where you want to very well. I’m absolutely at a loss as to why the developers would not just keep this stationary on the screen like so many other games.
It's iPhone 8+ and it's ios 13.6.1.  It will be over in about 30 minutes while playing the game, so please correct it.

Ff6 is my favorite game i played before in gba and ps1 

the problem that in ios there is no option to run as in gba or ps1

I never played this title back in the day. I started on Final Fantasy IX, then X, then XII, then back to VII. I played the first two on mobile as well. Couldn’t play much on X-2 or XIII because they both sucked, and didn’t get the chance on VIII. So with that background, I wanted to try out the last of the 16-but era. I’m not interested in a 3D remake of a 2D game. I usually don’t like such changes in art style, but as I didn’t play the original, I don’t miss it, and at least there’s some censorship removed, only more lenient version is PS1, and I won’t deal with load times. Anyway, I’m about the halfway point now, leveling characters abilities up. All I can say on this app is you better save your game every 5 minutes, because it crashes quite often for no reason. And cloud saving crashes it about half the time, although at least you don’t lose progress there. I’m using an iPhone 8 Plus with the latest update. Not sure if it’s simply Apples iOS updates breaking these games, or that the game developers have gotten lazy. I’ve read many reviews that say this is a sloppy port. Gotta say, up until FF13 it seems Square put forth a better effort. FF12 is easily the best of the 3D for playability, 10 for the linear story, and 9 is still my favorite as it was my first.

name.label: to much of the turh hurts

content.label:
I keep experiencing the game closing out randomly after a couple hours gameplay. 
However 
It’s a good game and well worth the money so please fix the issue thanks.

Downgraded this to 1 star due to way too frequent crashes.  Unacceptable for a pay to play app. 

Not a very good port to the IOS platform.  The game and story is one of the best final fantasy titles. But this version is nothing but terrible.  The controls are so awkward it’s almost unplayable.  I was hoping to get a good shot of nostalgia by playing this, but all I got was frustration simply trying to walk.  The game continuously crashes in the middle of battles, some of which take a while to complete. This needs a lot of work before it can get even 3 stars.

It’s also significantly harder than the original for reasons I don’t understand.  In general, it hasn’t been a very good experience.  If you’re just looking for nostalgia, use an emulator and play the original. This is hardly worth it as a free game, and 100% not worth $15

title.label: Great but crashes all the time

content.label: FFVI is my favorite game of the series and the mobile version is great. The new art is really excellent. The only thing is that the app crashes a lot. Only today, it’s crashed on me THREE times. I’ve got the latest version and my phone is up to date. I hope that’s fixed at some point because it means I lose a lot of progress...

Wonderful game I used to think that I wouldn’t like it because of the graphics but I’ve gotten used to them. My only gripe is that the frame rate drops in some areas for some reason for short amounts of time and then it catches back up. I’m on an iPhone 11 Pro Max.

Update: Crashes at random times

I know that you all fixed the loophole/cheat to make sure the intangir battles remain true to how tough this enemy is but now there’s another bug - at least on the app version. When you get the intangir to around 2500 hit points the app crashes. Like clockwork. I’ve let go of trying to learn Stragos transfusion because it’s not possible if the app crashes every time you fight intangir. 
Still really enjoying playing the game. But just annoying that the app crashes so much on one monster.

I’ve got 99% through the game without this issue but I’m finding that during some intense battles in dragons den the game starts to crash. Appears to be random as to when it happens.. but usually on the last big battle of a round I think

This port is really rough. Game play was interrupted so frequently that I gave up a third of the way through the game.

The storyline is amazing, and I generally enjoy the series, but I would not spend the money on this for iOS as it is not even functional.

title.label: Sloppy port of a great game

content.label:
First thing is a persistent bug where the game crashes after you upload your data to iCloud. Dev needs to fix that.

More broadly, the aesthetic of the port is weirdly integrated: the fonts are off, as is the general presentation. The whole thing looks like of slapdash and amateurish. They didn’t take the time to seamlessly integrate the existing assets - i.e., everything from the original SNES game - into the new iOS presentation. It doesn’t show the care that really high-level retro revival games do - e.g., Celeste or Bleak Sword.

The underlying game is still great enough - if endearingly earnest and try-hard - that the aesthetic issues with the port don’t keep you from enjoying it.
Please make the movement joystick fixed in the bottom left like in the iPad version ff7

Anchor the movement pad, it’s unusable as is.

Tapping anywhere on the screen is too sensitive during battles. You should have to press the buttons themselves.

If you fix these things then I will play this game. I bought it but am disappointed at the lack of usability.

title.label: Updated character sprites make me want to burn my eyes out!

content.label:
This is arguably one of the greatest role-playing games ever made, with one of the, if not the single worst ports ever!

All of the charm and emotion of the original 16-bit character sprites is gone and replaced with some creepy doll-like flash game character renderings. It makes an otherwise grand masterpiece nearly unplayable. This game needs a redo, bad!

If you want a proper 16 bit mobile port look into the Romancing Saga games. Considering they were also done by Square it makes this game look even worsen

title.label: The best FF an unstable port

content.label: This game would be great but it crashes constantly, which I dealt with until the last boss. I can’t beat the game because it eventually crashes during the long final boss fight. It’s maddening to play dozens of hours and not be able to finish the game.

Currently on iOS 13, I am unable to pilot the airship. I can see the Up arrow indicating that the airship can go up but I keep entering the airship with the touchscreen. I also paired my Bluetooth controller and pressing the Confirm button gets you inside the airship. The game is currently broken. Please fix it.

title.label: Worst controls of any FF game on mobile.

content.label:
I own every classic Square Enix game for iPhone and FF6 has by far the worst controls. Everything else about the game is perfect, I’ve played it more than any other mobile game and it’s my all time favorite Final Fantasy. But the controls are just hideous. It’s hard to even walk in a straight line, and there are several parts in the game where you do actually have to make some precise movements.

I would still recommend this game over any other app.

title.label: The most beautiful story and gameplay

content.label: squaresoft prior to being merged with enix had played their cards right making this game. It had so many directors and people with different ideas that came together beautifully to create the most immersive endearing game play I can remember. Now a remake of this game would just make me lose my mind. In a good way of course!
Quite simply the best Final Fantasy game there is. The story is amazing.

title.label: One of the all time greats!

content.label:
It took them forever to fix this after the latest update, I’m scared to update my phone now because I don’t want it to break again.
 Save often, like every 5 min or even more than that, cause it will crash, but it’s such a good story and fun battles that you put up with it. I beat this thing well over 20 years ago, never thought I’d play it again on a phone....

title.label: Best final fantasy.  -1 star for occasional crash and progress-loss

content.label: Not much else to say that’s not in the title.

The game keeps crashing on me, when I finish a section in the game, and I think there is a bug that constantly takes action and the app ends up crashing on me, but all and all, this game is amazing with its story, gameplay and characters.

title.label: Decent Port - Needs Aspect Ratio Options

content.label:
Final Fantasy VI is a wonderful game that is truly one of the all time greats. This port is a decent way to play the game in today’s mobile focused world. 

One thing this port would benefit from is the ability to restore the aspect ratio to the original, similar to the iOS port of Final Fantasy IV. That one hasn’t been updated in 3 years, but it allows for changing the aspect ratio to original instead of the stretched aspect ratio that this port forces. 

I hope that the developers add this option. The stretching really puts off a good number of potential players. More so even than the smoothed graphics.
The game is still awesome, but the controls blow donkey. Also I believe some of the text was changed for unknown snowflake reasons.

I love this game!! Brings back so many memories. I’ve put so many hours into this game as a kid. 
The only reason for the 3 star is that the game continues to crash on a semi-regular basis. As long as you quick save all the time, it’s no problem. But when you’re in the middle of fighting intangir for the first time and the game crashes it can be infuriating! Get half way through the magitek research facility and it crashes. On and on. If the crashes can be fixed I’d love to give this game a 5 star.

Playing on iPhone X. The game used to look pretty great, but the current version is stretched way too far. Why bother overhauling the sprites, then ruining even that. By far the worst version of this game.

Great game though.

title.label: For any veterans of the game -

content.label: Ignore every other bad review. I played this on the SNES, loved it as a kid. Now to have the entire game on my phone, it’s amazing and nostalgic. I hear people complain about the moving controls, I don’t share this belief. It’s perfectly well. It’s obviously not a control, aside from that I enjoy every aspect. The new sprites are something I’ve heard negative things of. To this I say it’s a lovely sight. Although I am a fan of the classic look, I don’t mind these new ones at all. The battles are smooth and great, so there’s really no negative at all that I have found. It’s an amazing game and I want to thank the company for putting them on sale January 5th, I bought 3 games and I’m excited to complete them all. Happy playing my fellow final fantasy fanatics, the choice is yours to buy, I don’t regret it but then again I got mine for a cheaper price. Very much worth it.

Edit—
They appear to have finally fixed the problem causing the game to be unplayable in iOS 13. I do find it funny though that their description of the patch is “Fixed minor bugs.” I wouldn’t describe the game being literally unplayable as a “minor” problem, but at least they did fix it.

———

Like many others have said, the game is broken in iOS 13 and is unplayable.

I reached out to Square Enix about this and I was told they were aware of the issue and are supposedly working on a fix but did not know when one would be available. It is disturbing that they would knowingly continue to take money from Apple customers for a product that can’t be used, but I guess that’s the current state of Square Enix. I did reach out to Apple about this as well, but was given a non-response back that can be summed up as “we don’t care lol.”

Buyers beware, do not allow Square Enix to steal your money while this app is broken! It’s a great game, but only when it’s playable! You CAN request a refund through iTunes if your purchase was made recently, as well!

title.label: Autosaved to a point where you die!  Game Ruined!

content.label:
Had been playing this a few hours, game was great. However you only have one save point and cannot choose when the game Autosaves which is what ruins it. 

After playing 5 hours it's very disappointing that when my game loads in, king Bannon dies immediately and the game ends. Try to reload? Same thing happens immediately with an enemy 2 steps away from him and nothing I can do to stop it. Noticed some other reviews mentioning this same scenario but without being able to go to a previous save point my game is ruined and I have to restart a new game or just give up. Nobody wants to play the same 5 hours of game to get back to the point they were. I can't imagine how they designed this game to let this happen. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND BUYING THIS.
I love this game, has there been any thought to make this Apple TV compatible? Overall awesome!

title.label: Bugs fixed in a not so timely manner.

content.label:
Edit-12/12/19-
When iOS 13 rolled out it effectively crippled this game. Now, it seems, SE has finally updated this game. I haven’t encountered any more bugs so far but the reason I won’t go above 4 stars is the horrible customer support/service.
Slots crash the game, not game stopping but still annoying to not get to use a character because his ability breaks the game.
I would love to see this, and all other Final Fantasy titles on Apple TV.
After the last update the game runs flawlessly and I can play one of the best FF games again
Can play again
Although I wouldn’t call the old bugs minor, I’m glad Square Enix came back to this game and fixed it. If you can get this game on any other platform you should, but it’s still a great purchase.

title.label: Great game, not a great company.

content.label:
They finally fixed FF6, it has been broke since iOS 13 was released in September. Told them about the issue multiple times and they just kept saying they were aware. 

It’s finally fixed. Now that the menus are fixed and the Quicksave issue is solved it gets 5 stars, but the company should have more integrity to have either stopped selling it or to have fixed it within a couple of weeks.
iOS 13 broke the game but SquareEnix quickly acknowledged the issue and eventually fixed it. Game runs perfectly now. Thanks for continuing to update it after all these years!

These were not "minor bug fixes".  Developer removed the wide versus standard screen options from the config menu.  On iPhone X/Xs models, the display is still stretched too wide, causing distortion in all visuals. The aspect ratio is fixed and is NOT correct.  THIS STILL NEEDS TO BE ADDRESSED.
